user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_FdSet_ConvertIn_Impl:
```c
static int32 OS_FdSet_ConvertIn_Impl(int *os_maxfd, fd_set *os_set, const OS_FdSet *OSAL_set)
{
    size_t       offset;
    size_t       bit;
    osal_index_t id;
    uint8        objids;
    int          osfd;
    int32        status;

    status = OS_SUCCESS;
    for (offset = 0; offset < sizeof(OSAL_set->object_ids); ++offset)
    {
        objids = OSAL_set->object_ids[offset];
        bit    = 0;
        while (objids != 0)
        {
            id = OSAL_INDEX_C((offset * 8) + bit);
            if ((objids & 0x01) != 0 && id < OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES)
            {
                osfd = OS_impl_filehandle_table[id].fd;
                if (osfd >= 0)
                {
                    if (osfd >= FD_SETSIZE || !OS_impl_filehandle_table[id].selectable)
                    {
                        /* out of range of select() implementation */
                        status = OS_ERR_OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED;
                    }
                    else
                    {
                        FD_SET(osfd, os_set);
                        if (osfd > *os_maxfd)
                        {
                            *os_maxfd = osfd;
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
            ++bit;
            objids >>= 1;
        }
    }

    return status;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The selected fragment contains the loop and all nested conditionals/branches where unreachable-code concerns are most likely to occur (e.g. a branch that can never be taken due to constant definitions/macros or an always-false/always-true condition). Other parts of the function are straightforward and not likely to contain statically unreachable code: variable declarations, the initial assignment status = OS_SUCCESS, the for-loop header (iterates over sizeof(OSAL_set->object_ids)), the increment/shift statements (++bit; objids >>= 1) included within the selected fragment, and the final return status; these are either simple reachable operations or are already encompassed by the suspicious fragment above and therefore do not require separate investigation.
